image.altText: A multi-storey brick building bearing letters that read "Base Hospital".

props.synopsis: Victorian mother of two Karla Lee Jordan was 50 years old when she died by her own hand in 2019. A coronial inquest has found she was subject to long-term stress in a workplace plagued with cultural issues.

title.children: Toxic culture contributed to hospital worker taking own life, coroner finds

image.altText: Officers in forensics uniforms outside a house.

props.synopsis: A court has heard the events surrounding the opioid overdose deaths of four people in Melbourne's northern suburbs last year.

title.children: Neighbours recount frantic discovery of four dead in Melbourne overdose

image.altText: Melbourne wholesale market traders protest rent rises at the Epping site

props.synopsis: Vendors have been given 30 days to pay higher rents before the state government-owned market authority says it will take legal action against them.

title.children: Melbourne Market vendors sent eviction notices as rents rise

image.altText: A man in a suit outside of a court house

props.synopsis: Far-right activist Thomas Sewell tells a court he has emailed all nine Attorneys-General about charges over his alleged involvement in a white supremacist rally, saying they breach the Australian Constitution.

title.children: Magistrate says Neo-Nazi leader's case 'going in circles' after email claim

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron, Zak Butters and Eric Hipwood celebrate goals

props.synopsis: The AFL is ripe with some fresh contenders this season, but Gather Round shows they won't simply be able to stroll their way to the premiership without experiencing some growing pains.

title.children: Ominous warning from AFL's old guard to new contenders

image.altText: Willie Rioli celebrates

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide forward Willie Rioli missed club training on Tuesday morning in the wake of the furore around his social media post about Hawthorn.

title.children: Rioli granted day off as club supports forward following social media post

image.altText: A female student completes her exam using a laptop.

props.synopsis: A review has found the accidental revelation of exam material in VCE practice sheets could be traced back to a new, faster production technique that was introduced to expedite production.

title.children: Pressure to make up for exam delays led to 2024 VCE blunder, review finds

image.altText: Apollo Bay hotel next to Great Ocean Road with people crossing hte road. Hill in the background.

props.synopsis: A caravan park once known as a "sleepy hollow" will cut down the number of sites and introduce glamping, but some locals say it's not what the town and its visitors need.

title.children: Great Ocean Road campground to get a glow-up, but not everyone's happy

image.altText: A suburban house seen through a wooden house frame

props.synopsis: Both major parties have pitched housing sector reform but experts say the lack of housing supply in Australia is not being adequately addressed.

title.children: Labor and Coalition housing policies could drive up prices, experts say

image.altText: A man with dyed blonde hair with black roots in a white collared shirt stands outside near a tall glass apartment building.

props.synopsis: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

title.children: Voters unhappy negative gearing, stamp duty not on horizon this election

image.altText: A composite image of two posters of Zoe Daniel and Tim Wilson.

props.synopsis: Across the historically conservative stronghold of Goldstein, voters are tuning in for a federal election rematch between the Liberals and the teals. These are some of the issues on their minds.

title.children: 'They've had their time': Can a teal MP win a second go in Goldstein?

image.altText: Uncle Carey wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A large majority of Aboriginal community-owned health facilities in Victoria are in urgent need of infrastructure funding, according to a new report from the state's top advisory body and peak body for Indigenous health.

title.children: Indigenous elders say crumbling health facilities are fracturing community

image.altText: A woooden mail box with the number 33 stands in the middle of an empty block

props.synopsis: New data shows dozens of suburbs around the country are at risk of becoming uninsurable, triggering warnings of a "climate-induced credit crunch".

title.children: This town is a 'canary in the coal mine' as climate change threatens home ownership

image.altText: Willie Rioli holding a footy on field with other players

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide player Willie Rioli posted to social media to explain his "hatred" of the Hawks stems from his family's historical relationship with the club.

title.children: Willie Rioli's 'hatred' of Hawthorn outlined in deleted social media post

image.altText: A young, shirtless man with long, dark hair stands outside a house.

props.synopsis: A Victorian inquest finds that Jodus Murphy, 18, was likely freezing before he died in the Goulburn River near Seymour in 2023.

title.children: 'Loved young man' likely had hypothermia before river death, coroner finds

image.altText: David Littleproud says Labor's Lisa Chester has "as much pull as a chihuahua"

props.synopsis: Bendigo MP Lisa Chesters has slammed "disrespectful" comments by Nationals leader David Littleproud and asked the party to rethink its language towards women.

title.children: Nationals leader compares Bendigo MP's political pull to a 'chihuahua'

image.altText: A composite image of a Monique Ryan poster and an Amelia Hamer poster.

props.synopsis: While some Kooyong voters in Melbourne's east say teal independent Monique Ryan has performed well, others say they have not seen much change, as the Liberals seek to win back the formerly blue-ribbon seat.

title.children: In Melbourne's leafy east, two candidates fight for a key seat

image.altText: Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne

props.synopsis: The Royal Children's Hospital says it is working with the RCH Foundation to continue funding 13 positions that it  had planned to cut.

title.children: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital backs down from Cancer Centre job cuts

image.altText: An older man with grey hair and a beard staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: John Green was an ABC reporter for 10 years and never thought he'd end up living on the streets. A mental health episode led to a decade sleeping rough.

title.children: Free camping grounds a haven for 'more people than ever' sleeping rough

image.altText: Two piggy banks on a see-saw, a larger pig weighing a side down, the challenge of financial equality in relationships.

props.synopsis: Experts say it is common for women to walk away with less than they are entitled to when it comes to superannuation in divorce or during a separation.

title.children: Why super can feel 'tricky' to navigate for women going through divorce

image.altText: A profil photo of Richard Zachariah wearing a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Zachariah was a journalist, author and co-hosted The Home Show on the ABC in the 1990s with the television personality and fashion icon Maggie Tabberer.

title.children: Former television and radio broadcaster Richard Zachariah dies aged 80

image.altText: Ruby Gill sits at a piano stool facing out, her arms wrapped around herself. She's got dark hair with a fringe and glasses

props.synopsis: Ruby Gill was born and raised in Johannesburg, South Africa, but now the musician calls Australia home. She talks about her new album, touring the country in a tent and the lessons we can learn from animals.

title.children: Ruby Gill didn't realise she was queer until she wrote this song

image.altText: Police tape is seen across a city street with a car in the foreground and a car in the background.

props.synopsis: A man with a gunshot wound approached officers for help in Melbourne's CBD early Sunday morning after a shooting on Collins Street.

title.children: Police investigating after man shot in morning attack in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: A close up of a baby in white muslin wrap with stars on it, being held by two adults. No faces are visible.

props.synopsis: While experts say this case is "unprecedented" in Australia, it's happened multiple times in the US, as far back as 1999.

title.children: 'Human error' to blame for Monash IVF embryo mix-up — could it happen again?

image.altText: Raneem Abu Izneid looks at the camera seriously.

props.synopsis: Australian citizen Ranem Abu-Izneid lost sight in one eye after being struck by shrapnel while studying in her university accommodation in the West Bank. She says five months on from the incident, she's no closer to getting any accountability.

title.children: Injured Australian student still seeking answers after alleged West Bank shooting

image.altText: A dingo glances towards the camera in the late afternoon light.

props.synopsis: A year after the Victorian government banned lethal control of dingoes in the state's north-west, a farmer on a national park border says authorities need to do more prevent the predators' constant bloody raids on his livestock.

title.children: Mallee farmer says sheep under constant attack from protected dingoes

image.altText: Nyadol Nyuon looks at the camera seriously.

props.synopsis: A high-profile lawyer asked to oversee the delivery of a $800,000 Victorian workplace safety project says she left early, after it instead left her feeling "victimised" in her own job.

title.children: Lawyer says project to protect women at work ended in 'perfect failure'

image.altText: A very toothy fish mouth.

props.synopsis: Four kilometres below the surface of the Tasman Sea is a strange world inhabited by even stranger creatures. In its autumn voyage, the CSIRO's Research Vessel Investigator took a closer look.

title.children: Deep sea photos reveal the otherworldly creatures of Bass Canyon

image.altText: a bird with a tall crest on its head and colourful wings.

props.synopsis: Birdwatching is soaring in popularity, with research showing it reduces distress and boosts mental wellbeing, while also providing crucial data about bird populations.

title.children: Birdwatching leaves twitchers flying high while tracking species

image.altText: Jodie and Adam Knell - pls blur baby's face (2)

props.synopsis: Former members of strict religious groups have told the ABC about their loved ones shunning them after they left, breaking their families apart.

title.children: Jodie and Adam were happy in their church community — then came the split

image.altText: An empty outdoor lap pool

props.synopsis: The regional Victoria town of Maryborough's closest outdoor pool is a 45-minute drive away and residents are worried their children are missing crucial time in the water.

title.children: Election pledge renews hope for country pool after three-year closure

image.altText: A close-up of someone wearing a t-shirt depicting Clinton Austin.

props.synopsis: A coroner is told Indigenous man Clinton Austin waited more than two years for NDIS support prior to being found unresponsive in his jail cell.

title.children: First Nations man died in prison after waiting years for disability support, inquest told

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A three-year-old child has died, and a 71-year-old woman has been arrested after a collision on Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula.

title.children: Three-year-old child dies after collision in Victorian beach town

image.altText: Man on beach with sombre expression.

props.synopsis: Robert Charles Eccles has pleaded not guilty to four charges of indecent acts and five charges of sexual penetration involving a 16-year-old boy in Warrnambool in 2012 and 2013.

title.children: Jury set to retire in trial of junior footy 'mentor' on sex charges

image.altText: Tim Smith wearing a dark suit with a red flower pinned to the collar.

props.synopsis: Former Married at First Sight contestant Tim Smith has made a citizen's arrest, detaining a teenager allegedly wielding a machete in the streets of Prahran.

title.children: MAFS contestant detains teen allegedly armed with machete in Prahran
